column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 3. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.
column6: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column8: be in the lane closest to the left curb.

column2: 4. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column6: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column8: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.

column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 11. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column6: You must bear either right or left
column8: A road joins from the left

column2: 13. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 15. Which of the following must you obey over the others?

column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 19. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: When it has just begun to rain.
column6: If it's been raining several hours.
column8: When it's been raining from at least one hour.

column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column6: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column8: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 21. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
22. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 23. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:

column4: Do not pass on the left.
